org.apache.cocoon.generation
Class XfolioDirectoryGenerator

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.avalon.framework.logger.AbstractLogEnabled
      org.apache.cocoon.xml.AbstractXMLProducer
          org.apache.cocoon.generation.AbstractGenerator
              org.apache.cocoon.generation.ServiceableGenerator
                  org.apache.cocoon.generation.DirectoryGenerator
                      org.apache.cocoon.generation.XfolioDirectoryGenerator
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.avalon.excalibur.pool.Poolable, org.apache.avalon.excalibur.pool.Recyclable, org.apache.avalon.framework.activity.Disposable, org.apache.avalon.framework.component.Component, org.apache.avalon.framework.logger.LogEnabled, org.apache.avalon.framework.service.Serviceable, org.apache.cocoon.caching.CacheableProcessingComponent, org.apache.cocoon.generation.Generator, org.apache.cocoon.sitemap.SitemapModelComponent, org.apache.cocoon.xml.XMLProducer
public final class XfolioDirectoryGenerator
extends org.apache.cocoon.generation.DirectoryGenerator

Extends DirectoryGenerator to replace default attributes and add nested elements - This generator accept the same parameters as the default DirectoryGenerator (depth, includes, excludes...) This generator assume that the files listed will be served by cocoon with the same hierarchy. <dir:file modified="2004-06-30H20:15:26" name="index_fr.sxw" radical="index" xml:lang="fr" extension="sxw" type="application/vnd.sun.xml.writer" href="tests/O1%20Section/index_fr" length="13236"> </dir:file> modified date is provide in XML format name is detailed in radical, lang, extension according to XFolio naming convention type/mime given by the web.xml of the servlet href, a target relative to the generated directory (useful for a autotoc for example)

caching - The cache key of this generator is made of all the listed files, even the one used to add info about a directory. So the XML is generated only if one file used changes. Good practice is of course to include also cacheable records. A detail, if you change a pipeline generating meta record, this global directory will not be informed till it is regenarated (for example after a touche of only one file in the scope).

caching -

Version:
CVS $Id: XfolioDirectoryGenerator.java,v 1.1 2004/04/30 16:49:48 frederic Exp $
Author:
Glorieux, Frédéric

setNodeAttributes

protected void setNodeAttributes(java.io.File path)
                          throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
Extends the setNodeAttributes method from the DirectoryGenerator by adding width, height and comment attributes if the path is a GIF or a JPEG file. And some more useful Xfolio information ("lang", "radical", "branch" ...). TODO: previous / next

Overrides:
setNodeAttributes in class org.apache.cocoon.generation.DirectoryGenerator
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException

startNode

protected void startNode(java.lang.String nodeName,
                         java.io.File path)
                  throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
Extends the startNode() method of the DirectoryGenerator. - Idea is to include a generated file from sitemap with an URI like cocoon:/{branch}{fileRadical}.xfoliodir App developper could then provide the nicest records he can from source and XSL In case of directory, the best source files to inform it will be searched 1) index files (what ever the format or the lang extension) 2) the first files with the same radical

Overrides:
startNode in class org.apache.cocoon.generation.DirectoryGenerator
Parameters:
nodeName - the node currently processing
path - the file path
Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException - in case of errors

getRadical

public java.lang.String getRadical(java.io.File file)
Give radical of a file according to XFolio logic - .* or _* are considered out of navigation, so without radical.

getLang

public java.lang.String getLang(java.io.File file)
Give lang of a file according to XFolio practices - .*_(??)\.extension, where (??) is an iso language code on 2 chars extend to other locale ?
